stepTitle: Suppose you first walk $$12.0$$ $$m$$ in a direction $$20$$ degrees west of north and then $$20.0$$ $$m$$ in a direction $$40.0$$ degrees south of west. How far are you from your starting point? (If you represent the two legs of the walk as vector displacements A and B, as in Figure $$3.51$$, then this problem finds their sum.)
